ITEMS.TITLE: Average
ITEMS.EXAMPLE: The average of the following three numbers [2,4,6] is (2 + 4 + 6)/3 = 12/3 = 4
ITEMS.DETAILS: The sum of a list of numbers divided by the number of numbers

ITEMS.TITLE: Median
ITEMS.EXAMPLE: For e.g. To find the Median of the list of numbers [11,2,5]. Arrange them in order [2,5,11]. The middle is 5 which is the median
ITEMS.DETAILS: Median is the "middle" of list of numbers arranged in "order"

ITEMS.TITLE: Mean
ITEMS.EXAMPLE: The mean or average of the following three numbers [2,4,6] is (2 + 4 + 6)/3 = 12/3 = 4
ITEMS.DETAILS: Mean is synonymous to Average which is the sum of a list of numbers divided by the number of numbers

ITEMS.TITLE: Mode
ITEMS.EXAMPLE: For e.g. The mode of the following numbers [2,4,2,6,4,2] is 2 because 2 appears more often than any other number in the list
ITEMS.DETAILS: The value that appears most often in a list of data

ITEMS.TITLE: Statistics
ITEMS.EXAMPLE: For e.g. Mean, Median, Mode etc. are part of statistics because they help us understand data better
ITEMS.DETAILS: Statistics is how we analyze, present and organize data. It helps us understand data better
